variants.Description in input context: Mutation of Cys331 to Arg in the RBR domain of Parkin

Material used.Description: Recombinant Parkin and PACRG proteins were used to study their interaction and ubiquitination activity.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Loss of interaction with PACRG and destabilization of Parkin
Readout description.Result Description: The C331R mutation in Parkin disrupted its interaction with PACRG, leading to reduced stability and increased auto-ubiquitination.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the abstract.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the abstract.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type Parkin was used as a positive control for ubiquitination activity.

Basic negative control.Description: No PACRG was used as a negative control to confirm the necessity of PACRG for Parkin stabilization.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Not explicitly described in the abstract.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Ubiquitination activity greater than 70% of wild-type.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Ubiquitination activity less than 30% of wild-type.

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transfected with Parkin and PACRG to study their subcellular localization.

Readout description.Result Description: The C331R mutation in Parkin led to mislocalization from the ER, unlike wild-type Parkin which co-localized with PACRG in the ER.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the abstract.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the abstract.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type Parkin was used as a positive control for ER localization.

Basic negative control.Description: No PACRG was used as a negative control to confirm the role of PACRG in ER localization.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Not explicitly described in the abstract.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Co-localization with PACRG in ER greater than 80%.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Co-localization with PACRG in ER less than 20%.
